label: BoxApi
description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the box API.

tools.name: AbortUploadSession
tools.description:
Abort an upload session and discard all uploaded data.

Use this tool to abort an ongoing upload session and discard all uploaded data. This action is irreversible, so it should be called when the user wants to cancel an upload session.

parameters.name: upload_session_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the upload session to be aborted. This ID is required to specify which upload session should be cancelled and its data discarded.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: CancelSignRequest
tools.description:
Cancel an existing sign request to stop further processing.

This tool cancels a sign request based on the provided sign request ID, preventing any further action on it.

parameters.name: sign_request_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the signature request to be cancelled.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: CheckUserInviteStatus
tools.description:
Retrieve the status of a specific user invite.

This tool is used to get the current status of a user invite by its ID.

parameters.name: invite_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the user invite you want to check. This ID is necessary to retrieve the invite's status.

parameters.name: included_attributes
parameters.description: A list of attributes to include in the response. Specify attributes not normally returned in a standard response. Only the mini representation fields are returned unless explicitly specified.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: CheckZipDownloadStatus
tools.description:
Check the status of a zip archive download.

Use this tool to inspect the download progress of a zip archive, including the number of skipped items. This endpoint should be accessed after the download starts and is available for 12 hours. Follow the `status_url` obtained from the Create zip download API.

parameters.name: zip_archive_unique_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier representing the zip archive for which to check download status. Obtainable from the `status_url` in the Create zip download API.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: DeleteAiAgent
tools.description:
Removes an AI agent by its ID.

This tool is used to delete an AI agent by specifying the agent's ID. It should be called when an AI agent needs to be removed from the system.

parameters.name: agent_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the AI agent you want to delete. This ID specifies which agent will be removed.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: DeleteArchive
tools.description:
Permanently delete an archive by ID.

Use this tool to permanently delete an archive using its unique ID. This action cannot be undone.

parameters.name: archive_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the archive to be permanently deleted. This ID is required for the deletion process.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: DeleteBoxFileVersion
tools.description:
Delete a specific file version from Box.

Use this tool to move a specific version of a file to the trash on Box. Applicable only for users with premium accounts.

parameters.name: file_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for a file in Box. Obtain it from the file's URL in the web app. Example: '123' for URL 'https://*.app.box.com/files/123'.

parameters.name: file_version_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the file version to be deleted. Obtainable from the Box platform.

parameters.name: if_match_etag_value
parameters.description: Pass the item's last observed etag value to ensure it hasn't changed before deletion. Use this to prevent conflicts.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: DeleteBoxHub
tools.description:
Delete a specific Box Hub using its ID.

This tool is used to delete a specific Box Hub by providing its unique hub ID. It should be called when a user wants to remove a particular hub from the Box service.

parameters.name: box_hub_unique_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for a Box Hub, obtainable from the hub's URL.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: DeleteBoxHubCollaboration
tools.description:
Remove a specific Box Hub collaboration.

Use this tool to delete a specific collaboration from a Box Hub by providing the collaboration ID. It should be called when you need to remove a user's collaboration access.

parameters.name: hub_collaboration_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the Box Hub collaboration to be deleted.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: DeleteCollaboration
tools.description:
Deletes a specified collaboration by ID.

This tool is used to delete a collaboration by providing the specific collaboration ID. It should be called when a collaboration needs to be removed from the system.

parameters.name: collaboration_id_to_delete
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the collaboration to be deleted. Provide this ID to remove the specified collaboration.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: DeleteComment
tools.description:
Permanently deletes a specific comment by ID.

Use this tool to permanently remove a comment by providing its unique ID. Call this when you need to delete a comment and ensure it's not recoverable.

parameters.name: comment_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the comment you want to permanently delete.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: DeleteDevicePin
tools.description:
Delete a specific device pin from the system.

This tool is used to delete a specified device pin by its unique identifier. It should be called when there is a need to remove a device pin.

parameters.name: device_pin_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the device pin to be deleted.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: DeleteFileFromBox
tools.description:
Delete a file from Box or move it to trash.

This tool deletes a file from Box. Depending on enterprise settings, the file is either permanently deleted or moved to the trash. It should be called when a user requests to remove a file from their Box storage.

parameters.name: file_identifier
parameters.description: The unique ID representing a file in Box. Found in the URL when viewing a file: https://*.app.box.com/files/{file_id}.

parameters.name: ensure_no_recent_changes_etag
parameters.description: Pass the file's last observed etag value to ensure it hasn't changed before deletion. If the etag has changed, the operation will fail.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: DeleteFileMetadata
tools.description:
Deletes metadata from a specified file.

Use this tool to delete a specific piece of metadata from a file by providing the file ID, metadata scope, and template key.

parameters.name: file_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for a file, retrievable from the file URL, e.g., `https://*.app.box.com/files/123` where `123` is the ID.

parameters.name: metadata_scope
parameters.description: Specifies the scope of the metadata template. Choose 'global' or 'enterprise'.

parameters.name: metadata_template_name
parameters.description: The name of the metadata template to be deleted from the file.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: DeleteFileRequest
tools.description:
Permanently delete a specific file request.

Use this tool to permanently delete a file request by its ID.

parameters.name: file_request_identifier
parameters.description: The unique ID representing a file request, extracted from the URL in the file request builder.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: DeleteFolder
tools.description:
Delete a folder permanently or move it to the trash.

Use this tool to remove a folder from Box, either permanently or by sending it to the trash.

parameters.name: folder_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier representing a folder. Determine it by copying the ID from the folder's URL in the Box web application. The root folder ID is '0'.

parameters.name: ensure_unchanged_etag
parameters.description: Last observed `etag` value to ensure the folder hasn't changed before deletion. If changed, the operation fails with a 412 error.

parameters.name: delete_recursively
parameters.description: Set to true to delete a non-empty folder and all its content recursively.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: DeleteFolderLock
tools.description:
Delete a specific folder lock if you're the owner or co-owner.

Use this tool to delete a lock on a folder you own or co-own, ensuring that only authorized modifications are permitted.

parameters.name: folder_lock_identifier
parameters.description: The unique ID of the folder lock to be deleted. You must be the owner or co-owner of the folder.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: DeleteFolderMetadata
tools.description:
Deletes metadata from a specified folder.

Use this tool to remove a specific piece of metadata from a folder by providing the folder ID, scope, and template key.

parameters.name: folder_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for a folder. Obtainable from the folder URL; use '0' for the root folder.

parameters.name: metadata_template_scope
parameters.description: The scope of the metadata template. Choose either 'global' or 'enterprise'.

parameters.name: metadata_template_name
parameters.description: The name of the metadata template to be deleted from the folder.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: DeleteGroup
tools.description:
Permanently delete a group with admin permissions.

This tool is used to permanently delete a specified group. Only users with admin-level permissions are able to perform this action.

parameters.name: group_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the group to be permanently deleted. Must be used by an admin.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: DeleteGroupMembership
tools.description:
Delete a specific group membership by ID.

This tool deletes a group membership identified by its ID. It should be used by group admins or users with admin-level permissions to remove a member from a group.

parameters.name: group_membership_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the group membership to be deleted. Required for specifying which membership to remove.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: DeleteLegalHoldPolicy
tools.description:
Initiate deletion of a legal hold policy.

Use this tool to start the process of deleting an existing legal hold policy. The deletion is asynchronous, meaning the policy won't be fully deleted when the response is received.

parameters.name: legal_hold_policy_id
parameters.description: The ID of the legal hold policy to delete. This is necessary to identify and initiate the deletion of the specified policy.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: DeleteMetadataCascadePolicy
tools.description:
Deletes a metadata cascade policy by ID.

This tool deletes a specified metadata cascade policy using its unique ID. It should be called when you need to remove a cascade policy from your metadata handling.

parameters.name: metadata_cascade_policy_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the metadata cascade policy to be deleted. Ensure it is valid and exists.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: DeleteMetadataTemplate
tools.description:
Permanently delete a metadata template and its instances.

Use this tool to permanently delete a metadata template and all its instances. This action is irreversible and should be used with caution.

parameters.name: metadata_template_scope
parameters.description: Specifies the scope of the metadata template. Allowed values are 'global' or 'enterprise'.

parameters.name: metadata_template_name
parameters.description: The name of the metadata template to be permanently deleted.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: DeleteRetentionPolicy
tools.description:
Permanently deletes a specified retention policy.

Use this tool to permanently delete a retention policy by its ID. It should be called when there is a need to remove a retention policy completely.

parameters.name: retention_policy_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the retention policy to be permanently deleted.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: DeleteShieldBarrierSegmentRestriction
tools.description: Delete a specific shield barrier segment restriction by ID.

parameters.name: barrier_segment_restriction_id
parameters.description: The ID of the shield information barrier segment restriction to delete.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: DeleteShieldInformationBarrierSegment
tools.description:
Delete a shield information barrier segment by ID.

Use this tool to delete a specific shield information barrier segment by providing its ID.

parameters.name: shield_information_barrier_segment_id
parameters.description: The ID of the shield information barrier segment to delete. This should be a valid string representing the segment's unique identifier.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: DeleteShieldListById
tools.description:
Delete a shield list using its ID.

Use this tool to delete a specific shield list by providing its ID. Ideal for managing and updating list configurations when a list is no longer needed.

parameters.name: shield_list_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the shield list to be deleted. Obtainable from the response of fetching all shield lists for the enterprise.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: DeleteSlackIntegrationMapping
tools.description:
Deletes a Slack integration mapping for Box content.

This tool deletes a specified Slack integration mapping in Box. It requires admin or co-admin permissions. Use it when a Slack integration mapping needs to be removed.

parameters.name: slack_integration_mapping_id
parameters.description: The ID of the Slack integration mapping to be deleted. This requires Admin or Co-Admin permission.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: DeleteStoragePolicyAssignment
tools.description:
Delete a user's storage policy assignment.

Use this tool to delete a storage policy assignment for a user. After deletion, the user will inherit the enterprise's default storage policy. Note the rate limit of two deletions per user within 24 hours.

parameters.name: storage_policy_assignment_id
parameters.description: The ID of the storage policy assignment to delete. This is required and identifies which assignment to delete, reverting the user to the default policy.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: DeleteTaskAssignment
tools.description:
Delete a specific task assignment.

Use this tool to remove a specific task assignment by its ID. It confirms the deletion upon successful completion.

parameters.name: task_assignment_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the task assignment to be deleted.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: DeleteTaskFromFile
tools.description:
Removes a specific task from a file.

Use this tool to delete a specific task from a file by providing the task ID. It is useful when tasks need to be removed as part of file management.

parameters.name: task_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the task to be removed from the file.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: DeleteTeamsIntegrationMapping
tools.description:
Deletes a Teams integration mapping in Box.

Use this tool to delete a Teams integration mapping in Box. Admin or Co-Admin roles are required to perform this action.

parameters.name: integration_mapping_identifier
parameters.description: The ID of the Teams integration mapping to be deleted. Required for identifying the specific mapping.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: DeleteUserAccount
tools.description:
Delete a user account from the system.

Use this tool to delete a user account. Ensure the user does not own content, or use the 'force' option to remove the user along with their files.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the user to be deleted. Required for specifying which user account to delete.

parameters.name: send_deletion_notification
parameters.description: Indicate whether the user should receive an email notification about the deletion. Set to true to send notification.

parameters.name: force_delete_user
parameters.description: Set to true to delete the user and their files even if they still own content.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: DeleteWebhook
tools.description:
Delete a specified webhook.

This tool deletes a webhook when provided with its unique identifier. Use it to manage and remove webhooks that are no longer needed.

parameters.name: webhook_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the webhook to be deleted. It must be a valid string.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: DeleteWebLink
tools.description: Delete a specified web link based on its ID.

parameters.name: web_link_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the web link to be deleted.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: DownloadFileContent
tools.description:
Retrieve the binary content of a specified file.

This tool is used to download the contents of a file from a given file ID. It should be called when access to the file data in binary format is required.

parameters.name: file_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the file to download. Obtainable from the file's URL in the web application.

parameters.name: file_version_to_download
parameters.description: The specific version of the file to retrieve in binary format.

parameters.name: optional_access_token
parameters.description: A string for an optional access token to pre-authenticate the file download request. Ensure it's scoped for read access only.

parameters.name: download_byte_range
parameters.description: Specify the byte range for the content to download in the format `bytes={start_byte}-{end_byte}` to define which section of the file to retrieve.

parameters.name: shared_link_with_optional_password
parameters.description: Provide the shared link URL of the item. Include a password if required, using the format `shared_link=[link]` or `shared_link=[link]&shared_link_password=[password]`. This allows access to files not explicitly shared with the user.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: DownloadZipContent
tools.description:
Download the contents of a zip archive.

This tool retrieves the contents of a zip archive from a specified URL, which is valid for a short time. It's useful for downloading the archive to a device, but remember that once a download starts, it cannot be paused or resumed. A new request must be created for a fresh URL.

parameters.name: zip_archive_unique_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the zip archive to be downloaded. This ID must be obtained from the 'Create zip download' API response.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: FetchBoxSignTemplateDetails
tools.description:
Retrieve details of a specific Box Sign template.

This tool is used to fetch information about a specific Box Sign template by its ID. It should be called when users need to access detailed information about a sign template in Box.

parameters.name: box_sign_template_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for a Box Sign template to retrieve its details.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: FetchCommentDetails
tools.description:
Retrieve detailed information about a specific comment.

This tool fetches the message, metadata, and creator information for a specified comment ID. It should be used when detailed comment insights are needed.

parameters.name: comment_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the comment whose details are being fetched. This ID is required to retrieve the comment's message, metadata, and creator information.

parameters.name: include_fields
parameters.description: A list of attributes to include in the response. Only specified fields will be returned along with the mini representation.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: FetchEnterpriseStoragePolicies
tools.description:
Fetches all storage policies in the enterprise.

Use this tool to retrieve a complete list of storage policies available within an enterprise.

parameters.name: include_attributes
parameters.description: An array of attribute names to include in the response. Specify attributes not normally returned in a standard response. Only mini representation fields and requested attributes will be returned.

parameters.name: pagination_marker
parameters.description: Defines the starting position for returning results using marker-based pagination. Requires `usemarker` to be `true`.

parameters.name: max_items_per_page
parameters.description: Specify the maximum number of storage policy items to return per page.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: FetchMetadataTemplateById
tools.description:
Retrieve a metadata template using its ID.

Use this tool to get detailed information about a specific metadata template by providing its ID.

parameters.name: template_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the metadata template to be retrieved. Provide a valid template ID.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: FetchSafeCollaborationDomain
tools.description:
Retrieve a designated safe collaboration domain within an enterprise.

This tool is used to obtain information about a domain that has been marked as safe for creating collaborations within the current enterprise. It should be called when there is a need to verify if a domain can be trusted for collaboration purposes.

parameters.name: collaboration_whitelist_entry_id
parameters.description: The ID of the trusted domain entry in the whitelist. Provide this to retrieve its details.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: FetchShieldBarrierReport
tools.description:
Retrieve details of a shield information barrier report by ID.

Use this tool to get information about a specific shield information barrier report by providing its unique ID.

parameters.name: shield_barrier_report_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the shield information barrier report to retrieve.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: FetchSignatureRequests
tools.description:
Retrieve signature requests created by a user.

Fetches a list of signature requests that have been created by a user. Signature requests won't be listed if their associated files or parent folder are deleted.

parameters.name: pagination_marker
parameters.description: Defines the starting point for returning results, used for marker-based pagination. Requires use_marker to be true.

parameters.name: max_items_per_page
parameters.description: Specify the maximum number of signature requests to return per page.

parameters.name: sender_email_list
parameters.description: A list of sender emails to filter the signature requests by sender. `shared_requests` must be `true` if provided.

parameters.name: include_shared_requests
parameters.description: Set to true to include signature requests where the user is a collaborator but not the owner. Must be true if sender emails are provided.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: FetchStoragePolicy
tools.description:
Retrieve details of a specific storage policy.

Use this tool to fetch information about a particular storage policy using its ID. It is useful when you need to view or verify details of a storage policy by its unique identifier.

parameters.name: storage_policy_identifier
parameters.description: The unique ID of the storage policy to retrieve details for.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: FetchStoragePolicyAssignment
tools.description:
Retrieve a storage policy assignment by ID.

This tool is used to fetch detailed information about a specific storage policy assignment using its unique ID. Call this tool when you need to get details about a particular storage policy assignment in the Box storage system.

parameters.name: storage_policy_assignment_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the storage policy assignment to be retrieved.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: FetchStoragePolicyAssignments
tools.description:
Retrieve storage policy assignments for enterprise or user.

Use this tool to fetch all storage policy assignments associated with a specific enterprise or user, providing insights into storage management configurations.

parameters.name: target_type_for_assignments
parameters.description: Specifies whether to return storage policy assignments for a 'user' or 'enterprise'.

parameters.name: target_user_or_enterprise_id
parameters.description: The ID of the user or enterprise to fetch storage policy assignments for.

parameters.name: pagination_marker
parameters.description: Defines the position marker to start returning results for pagination. Requires 'usemarker' to be true.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: FindMetadataTemplate
tools.description:
Retrieve metadata template details by ID.

Use this tool to find and retrieve details of a metadata template by searching for the ID of a template instance.

parameters.name: metadata_instance_id
parameters.description: The ID of the metadata template instance to retrieve details for.

parameters.name: pagination_position_marker
parameters.description: Defines the starting position for marker-based pagination results. Requires `usemarker` to be `true`.

parameters.name: items_per_page_limit
parameters.description: Specify the maximum number of items to return per page for pagination purposes.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetAiAgentDefaultConfig
tools.description:
Retrieve the default configuration for the AI agent.

Call this tool to get the default settings and configurations for the AI agent. Useful for understanding the baseline setup or preparing to customize AI agent parameters.

parameters.name: filter_mode
parameters.description: Specifies the mode to filter and return the agent configuration. Options: 'ask', 'text_gen', 'extract', 'extract_structured'.

parameters.name: agent_config_language_code
parameters.description: The ISO language code to specify the language for the AI agent configuration. Default is returned if unsupported.

parameters.name: model_identifier
parameters.description: Specify the model name to retrieve the default agent configuration. Ensure it matches the supported model names.

tools.name: GetAiAgentDetails
tools.description:
Retrieve details of a specific AI agent by ID.

Call this tool to get detailed information about a specific AI agent using their unique agent ID.

parameters.name: agent_unique_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the AI agent to retrieve details for.

parameters.name: fields_to_return
parameters.description: List of specific fields to return in the response for the AI agent details.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetAuthenticatedUserInfo
tools.description:
Retrieve details of the currently authenticated user.

This tool retrieves information about the user who is currently authenticated via OAuth 2.0 or JWT. It can also be used with the `As-User` header to retrieve information on behalf of another user.

parameters.name: requested_user_attributes
parameters.description: List of user attributes to include in the response. Use to request non-standard fields, results in basic fields only unless specified.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetBoxDocgenJobDetails
tools.description:
Retrieve details of a Box Doc Gen job using its ID.

This tool fetches detailed information about a specific Box Doc Gen job, identified by its job ID. It should be called when details about a particular document generation task in Box are needed.

parameters.name: box_doc_gen_job_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the Box Doc Gen job you want details for.

tools.name: GetBoxDocgenTemplateDetails
tools.description:
Fetch details of a specific Box Doc Gen template.

Call this tool to retrieve detailed information about a specific template from Box Doc Gen using its template ID.

parameters.name: box_docgen_template_id
parameters.description: The ID of the Box Doc Gen template to retrieve details for.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetBoxEvents
tools.description:
Retrieve up to a year of past events for a user or enterprise.

Fetches past events for a specific user by default, or for the entire enterprise if the stream type is set. Requires admin privileges and appropriate application scope for enterprise events.

parameters.name: event_stream_type
parameters.description: Specifies the category of events to retrieve. Options: 'all' for all user events, 'changes' for file updates, 'sync' for synced folders, 'admin_logs' for full enterprise events (requires admin), and 'admin_logs_streaming' for live enterprise events (requires admin).

parameters.name: event_stream_start_position
parameters.description: Specifies where to start receiving events in the stream. Use 'now' for initialization or '0' to retrieve all events.

parameters.name: event_limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of events to retrieve. Fewer events may be returned if already available.

parameters.name: event_type_filter
parameters.description: List of event types to filter by. Only applicable for 'admin_logs' or 'admin_logs_streaming' stream types.

parameters.name: event_start_date
parameters.description: The start date and time for filtering events. Used only with 'admin_logs' stream type.

parameters.name: event_time_upper_bound
parameters.description: The upper bound date and time for returning events, used only with 'admin_logs' stream type. Ignored for other stream types.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetBoxHubCollaborationDetails
tools.description:
Retrieve details for a Box Hub collaboration by ID.

Use this tool to obtain information about a specific Box Hub collaboration by providing the collaboration ID.

parameters.name: hub_collaboration_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the specific Box Hub collaboration you want to retrieve details for.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetBoxHubs
tools.description:
Retrieve all Box Hubs for the user.

This tool retrieves all the Box Hubs associated with the requesting user. It should be called when there's a need to list or display the user's Box Hubs.

parameters.name: hub_search_query
parameters.description: The string to search for specific Box Hubs. Use keywords to refine search results.

parameters.name: hub_scope
parameters.description: Specifies which Box Hubs to retrieve. Options: `editable`, `view_only`, `all`. Default is `all`.

parameters.name: sort_results_by
parameters.description: Field to sort Box Hubs by: `name`, `updated_at`, `last_accessed_at`, `view_count`, `relevance` (default: `relevance`).

parameters.name: sort_direction
parameters.description: Specify the sort order: 'ASC' for ascending or 'DESC' for descending.

parameters.name: pagination_start_marker
parameters.description: Defines the position marker to begin returning results, used for marker-based pagination.

parameters.name: max_items_per_page
parameters.description: The maximum number of Box Hubs to return per page. Use for pagination control.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetBoxSignTemplates
tools.description:
Retrieve Box Sign templates created by a user.

Call this tool to get a list of all Box Sign templates that have been created by a specific user.

parameters.name: pagination_marker
parameters.description: The starting position marker for result pagination. Requires `usemarker` to be set to `true`.

parameters.name: max_items_per_page
parameters.description: The maximum number of templates to return in a single response.

tools.name: GetBoxSkillsMetadata
tools.description:
Retrieve Box Skills metadata cards for a given file.

parameters.name: file_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the file in Box. Obtainable from the file's URL in the Box web app.

tools.name: GetClassificationMetadata

summary:
BoxApi provides tools enabling LLMs to interact directly with the Box API, facilitating various file and folder operations within a Box environment.

### Capabilities
- Manage files, folders, and metadata.
- Collaborate with users through invitations and shared links.
- Monitor upload sessions, download statuses, and event logs.
- Handle legal hold and retention policies.
- Integrate with third-party applications like Slack and Teams.

### OAuth
- **Provider**: Unknown
- **Scopes**: None

### Secrets
- No secrets are required for using this toolkit.
